title: Federalist
notes: Supported strong central government
Favored ratification of Constitution
Led by Alexander Hamilton and John Adams
Supported by merchants and urban elites

title: Similarities
notes: Both influenced the U.S. Constitution
Both shaped early American political discourse
Concerned with preserving liberty and preventing tyranny

title: Anti-Federalist
notes: Favored strong state governments
Opposed ratification without Bill of Rights
Led by Thomas Jefferson and Patrick Henry
Supported by farmers and rural citizens

title: Whigs
notes: Favored Congressional power over the presidency
Supported modernization and economic protectionism
Opposed Andrew Jackson's policies
Strong in Northeast and among business interests

title: Similarities
notes: Both were major parties during the Second Party System
Both used national political conventions
Both addressed issues of federal power and economic policy

title: Democratic Party
notes: Emphasized states’ rights and limited government
Led by Andrew Jackson
Strong support from the South and West
Appealed to small farmers and working-class men

title: Great Awakening I
notes: Focused on emotional preaching and individual salvation
Key figures: Jonathan Edwards, George Whitefield
Challenged established churches

title: Similarities
notes: Religious revivals
Emphasized personal faith and conversion
Led to creation of new denominations
Influenced American culture and society

title: Great Awakening II
notes: Early 1800s–1830s
Linked to reform movements like abolition and temperance
Key figure: Charles Finney
Spread through revivals and camp meetings

title: 1st Industrial Revolution
notes: Late 1700s–early 1800s
Focused on textiles, steam power, iron
Centered in Britain and Northeast U.S.
Used water and steam power

title: Similarities
notes: Massive technological innovation
Urbanization and social change
Rise of labor issues and unions
Transformed economies and transportation

title: 2nd Industrial Revolution
notes: Mid-to-late 1800s
Focused on steel, electricity, oil, chemicals
Wider global impact, including U.S. and Germany
Mass production and factory systems

title: 1st Wave Feminism
notes: Late 1800s–early 1900s
Focused on suffrage and legal rights
Key figures: Susan B. Anthony, Elizabeth Cady Stanton
Achieved 19th Amendment (women's right to vote)

title: Similarities
notes: Fought for women's rights and equality
Faced social resistance
Inspired major social change
Influenced future feminist movements

title: 2nd Wave Feminism
notes: Focused on workplace rights, reproductive rights, equality
Key figures: Betty Friedan, Gloria Steinem
Challenged social norms and gender roles

title: WWI
notes: Trench warfare and static fronts
Caused by alliances and assassination of Archduke
Ended with Treaty of Versailles

title: Similarities
notes: Global conflicts
U.S. entered later in both wars
Massive loss of life
Redrew political maps and led to major international changes

title: WWII
notes: Blitzkrieg and total war
Caused by Axis aggression and failure of appeasement
Ended with Allied victory and atomic bomb use

title: New Deal
notes: 1930s under FDR
Focused on relief, recovery, and reform
Increased government intervention in the economy
Created Social Security and job programs

title: Similarities
notes: Responded to economic crises
Government used to shape national recovery
Both faced criticism from conservatives
Reform-minded agendas

title: Great Society
notes: 1960s under LBJ
Focused on ending poverty and racial injustice
Created Medicare, Medicaid, and civil rights laws
Expanded federal role in education and welfare

title: Progressive Era
notes: Targeted political corruption and industrial abuses
Led to antitrust laws and electoral reforms
Figures include Theodore Roosevelt, Jane Addams

title: Similarities
notes: Sought reform through government action
Challenged social inequality
Focused on economic fairness and justice
Had lasting policy impacts

title: Civil Rights Movement
notes: Targeted racial segregation and discrimination
Led to Civil Rights Act, Voting Rights Act
Figures include MLK Jr., Rosa Parks

title: Cold War Containment
notes: Focused on preventing spread of communism
Truman Doctrine, Korean and Vietnam Wars
Economic and military aid to allies

title: Similarities
notes: U.S. foreign policy strategies
Involved military and ideological engagement
Justified by global threats
Had long-term international impact

title: War on Terror
notes: 2001–present
Focused on defeating terrorism globally
Led to invasions of Afghanistan and Iraq
Emphasized homeland security and surveillance
